channel.title: Elyse in Wonderland
channel.description: Follow Elyse to learn a lot about our new world, Wonderland! We will discuss about different cultures, and multiculturalism in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.
channel.itunes:author: Elyse Pipitone and Jin Kim

item.title: 1-Intro
item.description: Introduce what is "Elyse in Wonderland"

item.title: 2-Welcome to Canada
item.description: Welcome international students in Canada

item.title: 3-SuperCrawl
item.description: Introduce Hamilton's SuperCrawl

item.title: 4-TIFF
item.description: Introduce Toronto International Film Festival

item.title: 5-Spanish (Feat. Luz Gonzalez)
item.description: Elyse when to Spain. Invite guest "Spanish show" host on FM 101.5

item.title: 6-Romanian (Feat. Ada Petra)
item.description: Invite guest from Romania

item.title: 7-Thanksgiving
item.description: [There was an issue on recording so middle part has been cut] Talk about Thanksgiving and what people are thankful of.

item.title: 8-Body Positivity (Feat. Cynthia)
item.description: Talk about Body Positivity with a guest, Cynthia.

item.title: 9-Sudan (Feat. Aziz)
item.description: Talk about Sudan with a guest, Aziz.

item.title: 10-Halloween (Feat. Maria Bracalenti)
item.description: This week, we invite Maria Bracalenti to talk about Halloween with costume dressed up! Are you ready for Halloween? Let us know what costume you will put on :)

item.title: 11-South Korea (Feat. Hyemin Kim, Thea Laidman)
item.description: This week, we will invite Hyemin Kim and Thea Laidman to talk about South Korea they recently visited!

item.title: 12-Immigration and Nigeria (Feat. Sam Taiwo)
item.description: This week, we will invite Dr. Taiwo to talk about his journey to come to Canada and about Nigeria.

item.title: 13-India - What do you REALLY know? (Feat. Chengappa)
item.description: This week Chengappa from Bangalore India spoke to us about the vast diversity of his country, some misconceptions about India, food from different regions and shared some traditional and modern music. You will certainly learn something new that will change your perception of India!

item.title: 14-World Fairy Tale Festival (Feat. Bernadette Rule)
item.description: [There was an issue so the audio quality isn't that great for the first 10 minutes.] Ever wonder how other countries express their folklore and #fairy tales? We discuss with author Bernadette Rule to unearth some difference in the way cultures tell tales through story.

item.title: 15-Karam Kitchen
item.description: What is your impression of Syria? On our next show, we interview three members of Hamilton’s Syrian Refugee run Karam Kitchen company, where we will discuss their experience coming to Canada, the community they have created through the love of traditional Syrian food, and their dreams for the future.

item.title: 16-Looking back on 2017
item.description: Elyse in Wonderland is looking back on 2017! Want to hear some of our favourite moments from our first year in radio, and learn about where we want to go from here? Tune in this Sunday! Let us know if you'd like to be added to our private messaging thread so you can ask us all sorts of questions LIVE :) Looking forward to celebrating 2017 with you this Sunday!

item.title: 17-Happy New Year
item.description: New Years Around the Globe – Dressing up in a bear suit, eating 12 grapes at the stroke of midnight, and wearing special coloured underthings to bring good fortune, learn about unique ways in which people around the world ring in the new year on our special HAPPY NEW YEAR edition of Elyse in Wonderland.

item.title: 18-Disability Awareness (Feat. Anthony Frisina, Julian Baird)
item.description: Today we talk to guests Anthony Frisina about his work with disability awareness through his TV show Above and Beyond, and Julian Baird about his experiences travelling the world with a disability. We will explore stigma, challenges, and advocacy for people with disabilities in our culture today. Looking forward to a great informative show!

item.title: 19-Mecca (Feat. MoeMoe)
item.description: Listen to our inspiring guest Mohamed Mohamed talks about his experience travelling to Mecca, and learn why this is such an important city. Don’t forget to join our group chat (https://www.facebook.com/messages/t/1440979949349340) to ask any questions you have for our guests.

item.title: 20-The World Travels of Denis Ranque
item.description: From Cameroon to France, to New Caledonia, Australia, and Bolivia – all before the age of 19! Denis will share his stories of travel, and experiences as a transplant in each new country he explored. Tune in to learn more about these vibrant cultures, and what Denis thinks about settling in Canada now.

item.title: 21-Lunar New Year (Feat. Maggie Chen)
item.description: Hug the nearest dog (if it’s safe to do so), because its YEAR OF THE DOG! Want to know why? Check out Elyse in Wonderland – Elyse and Jin travel around Asia picking up expensive red envelopes and eating too many dumplings.

item.title: 22-Elyse in Yukon
item.description: Adventures in the Yukon! Elyse comes back from her expedition up north with some new stories of a white wonderland - tune in to hear more about Canada’s rich northern history.

item.title: 23-Insider's look at the Olympic 2018
item.description: Ever wonder what it's like being in the action at the Olympic games? Tune in to hear from our guest Bob Glaister about his recent visit to South Korea at the PyeongChang Olympic!

item.title: 24-Ghostwriter (Feat. Jody Aberdeen)
item.description: Who you gonna call? GHOSTWRITER! Ever wonder what the life of a ghostwriter is like? Learn more about how our guest Jody fell into this field of work, and hear about his future plans for travel on next weeks episode

item.title: 25-Tammy Hwang's Many Hats
item.description: Working on Hamilton’s newcomer economic development, advising young professionals, and creating collaborative spaces for innovative work – Tammy does it all. Learn more about what makes Tammy love Hamilton so much, and where we’re headed as an “Intelligent Community”

item.title: 26-Ireland
item.description: “Top of the Morning to you” (and other things people don’t really say in Ireland). Come explore Dublin and Limerick with Elyse, as she discusses fairy myths, traditional songs and the food of this beautiful country.

item.title: 27-The Man From North India (Feat. Vinay Joshi)
item.description: Our old friend from India, Vinay Joshi is finally revealing his life before Canada and journey to Canada. He was an international student at Mohawk College and now he is helping students from India to success in Canada just like he did.

item.title: 28-Life of an Entertainer (Feat. Chris Mei)
item.description: Take a sneak peak backstage to the life and lessons of navigating the TV and Broadcasting world as we chat with Chris about jobs from Cruise Ship MC to Weatherman, and all the stories in between!

item.title: 29-Jin and Elyse Freestyle
item.description: Learn about what happened throughout our weeks, Jin’s upcoming plans to visit Korea amidst talk of peace treaties, and Elyse’s Indian wedding experience. Hear the latest tunes on their playlists, and much more.

item.title: 30-Doing Business in China (Feat. Maggie Chen)
item.description: Learn from our Recruiter Maggie Chen about her experience recruiting students in China, and tips like how to ride the subway at rush hour (hint, pushing is involved), and some cultural norms around how business is conducted in China!

item.title: 31-Much Ado about Peru! (Feat. Ceasar)
item.description: This episode we talk to Cesar about his journey to Canada, and his life’s mission of supporting Indigenous populations by putting his education to work for him, back in his home country of Peru.

item.title: 32-Life is Too Short Not to Laugh (Feat. Pramit Mehta)
item.description: This Thursday I'm SOLO in the studio, where I will talk about the growing trend of International interest in studying in Canada, and what it takes to stay positive in a new country. I will play my interview with one outstanding student Pramit Mehta, who has been recognized in a special way for the way his spreads joy to others via his infectious laughter. Follow his good work here; https://www.linkedin.com/in/capramit/ See you on Thursday!

item.title: 33-India to Indiana, Mumbai to Dubai (Feat. Jamshed)
item.description: From touring the world performing in orchestra pits on broadway, composing for television and movies for the likes of Disney, Cartoon Network, National Geographic and the NFB, to his role now as program coordinator and mentor of music students. I will talk to Jamshed Turel about his experiences thriving in new cultures.

item.title: 34-FanCulture Geek Out (Feat. David Thorne)
item.description: Join David Thorne and I as we talk about his recent experience as Celebrity Handler at Comicon, his passion for FX makeup, and what fan culture is all about!

item.title: 35-Vacation in Korea, Life in Canada
item.description: Jin is back from his vacation and he brought stories to tell us. He will tell us about his very busy vacation schedule, what his friends do, delicious fooooooood and recommended places to visit in Korea. He also wants to talk why it was difficult for him to come back to Canada this time. Let's ask him why.

item.title: 36-From Taiwan to Canada (Feat. Ceres Chen)
item.description: We will invite Ceres Chen who went to High school in the US, college in Canada and wants to study Master's degree in Europe. It will be interesting to hear how student life is different from the US to Canada, and why she wants to go to Europe for Master's degree. Be ready for the another unique international student's story!

item.title: 37-Japanese snow (Yuki) came for Canadian snow
item.description: We all know about Japan but have you met them in Hamilton? You probably haven't because even in Mohawk College, there is 1 Japanese student. His name is Yuki and we are going to hear how it feels to be only Japanese student in Mohawk.

item.title: 38-Club Wonderland
item.description: Club Wonderland is finally open! Where the world musics come to have fun. Please join us and taste songs you have never experienced! Not advised to 5 years old baby or under in case of too much bouncing :)

item.title: 39-Elyse in Europe
item.description: Long time no see! Elyse just came back from Europe and she brought lots of stories to share! Come to see her dynamic days in Germany, Prague, Austria, and Croatia.

item.title: 40-SuperCrawl with HartRidge
item.description: Are you excited for Hamilton's biggest event, SuperCrawl? We are and we will be part of the event as we will have a booth on Saturday 12-5PM. @HartRidge is also part of the event. They are selling goods for some months in ArtCrawl and they got approved seat in SuperCrawl on Friday and Sunday. Let's have a chat with them to learn more about their art concepts, the life of artists, and more

item.title: 41-Astronomy with Kathy and Tien
item.description: Space - The Next Frontier. Jin and Elyse climb aboard the rocket ship Wonderland, and chat with our Astronomy buff guests Kathy and Tien about their Astronomy club, and what they think of the future of space exploration.

item.title: 42-Brazil with Jacques and Ulysses
item.description: Brazil or Bust! We speak to Jacques Heri and Ulysses Almeida about their move to Canada, all the things they love about their home country, and Jin and Elyse fumble while learning Portuguese! Tune in to explore beautiful Brazil!

item.title: 43-English Education in South Korea (Feat. Janet Shin)
item.description: Ever wonder how people learn English in other countries? Every country may be different but especially Asian English education seems dramatically different than here. We will invite an English teacher from South Korea, Janet Shin.

item.title: 44-Wonderful Syria (Feat. Majdoulin)
item.description: Join us as we speak with Majdoulin Hareri about her Syria – and all of the history, traditions, customs and language of her country.

item.title: 45-Colombia (Feat. Ricardo)
item.description: We have a new family member in Mohawk International - Ricardo Rivera. Who helps South American students to come to Canada. It's time to discover Colombia and his amazing journey to Canada.

item.title: 46-Return of the Music King (Feat. Jamshed)
item.description: We chat with Jamshed Turel all about #music in #India, from its classical roots to its presence in #Bollywood, with live in-studio demos!

item.title: 47-Ritsona Refugee Camp (Feat. Alex, Abby)
item.description: In October 2018, 12 Mohawk College students travelled to Greece to volunteer with refugees. Hear from Alex and Abby, and how this experience has changed them.
